decks.notes: The key focus of this deck is to exert early pressure on the opponent by quickly deploying aggressive creatures and disrupting their game plan with targeted discard spells. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Tarmogoyf, while also generating card advantage and resilience through cards like Dark Confidant and Pack Rat. By applying consistent pressure and disrupting the opponent's strategy, the Golgari Aggro deck aims to secure a quick victory in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The Jund Aggro deck focuses on a balanced mix of disruption, removal, and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. With a combination of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay, along with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, the deck aims to control the early game and finish off the opponent with aggressive threats. The inclusion of cards like Liliana of the Veil and Raging Ravine further solidifies the deck's ability to maintain board presence and dominate the battlefield.

This deck focuses on disruption and value generation to control the board and outpace the opponent. Utilizing a mix of hand disruption, removal spells, and efficient creatures like Dark Confidant and Pack Rat, it aims to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Lingering Souls provides additional value and board presence, while cards like Restoration Angel and Blade Splicer offer versatility and synergy with other creatures in the deck. The mana base is tuned to ensure consistent casting of spells and to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to create a combo using cards like Splinter Twin, Deceiver Exarch, and Pestermite to repeatedly generate tokens with haste and deal damage to the opponent quickly. The deck also includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command for versatility and control options, as well as cards like Lightning Bolt for removal and disruption. The deck aims to efficiently assemble the combo pieces and protect them while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure a win through a powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on maintaining control over the board through a combination of prison-style enchantments like Ghostly Prison and Ensnaring Bridge, as well as board wipes such as Wrath of God and Anger of the Gods. It also disrupts opponent's strategies with cards like Blood Moon and Leyline of Sanctity. The win condition is to generate value over time with cards like Chandra, Pyromaster and Elspeth, Sun's Champion, while also creating a threatening board presence with Assemble the Legion. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's options and eventually overwhelm them with powerful planeswalkers and token creatures.

This Aggro Jund deck focuses on using efficient disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. The deck utilizes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Lightning Bolt to keep the board under control, while also having resilient threats like Olivia Voldaren and Batterskull to close out the game. The lands in the deck provide the necessary mana fixing to support the deck's powerful spells and threats.

The deck is focused on using aggressive tactics to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, supported by disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to control the board. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on using efficient aggressive creatures like Geralf's Messenger, Lotleth Troll, and Gravecrawler to quickly pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Tidehollow Sculler. Lingering Souls provides additional threats and Blasting Station can help finish off opponents or deal with problematic creatures. The deck also includes removal spells like Path to Exile and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is built to support the deck's black-centered strategy with a splash of green and white for additional utility.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent with low-cost creatures like Young Pyromancer and Delver of Secrets, while also using efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Vapor Snag to control the board. The deck also includes card draw and counterspells to keep up with the opponent's plays and maintain tempo. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for additional value from cards like Lightning Bolt and Serum Visions. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Leonin Arbiter and Aven Mindcensor, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Restoration Angel and Blade Splicer. The deck also utilizes cards like Linvala, Keeper of Silence to shut down activated abilities and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponents' spellcasting. Aether Vial helps to quickly deploy creatures while also allowing for instant-speed interactions. The land base is optimized for a smooth mana curve and includes utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Gavony Township.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deal direct damage to the opponent using burn spells and fast creatures. Utilizing efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze, along with powerful creatures like Goblin Guide and Eidolon of the Great Revel, the deck aims to pressure the opponent quickly and finish them off before they can stabilize. By utilizing a low mana curve and a relentless attack strategy, this deck is designed to win games swiftly through consistent and aggressive damage output.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive creature-based strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Wild Nacatl, Kird Ape, and Goblin Guide alongside powerful pump spells like Ghor-Clan Rampager and Boros Charm. The goal is to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure throughout the game, while also having access to strong removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix to deal with any threats the opponent may present. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to consistently deploy threats and close out games quickly.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board with efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Thoughtseize while deploying powerful threats such as Tarmogoyf, Phyrexian Obliterator, and Dark Confidant. Liliana of the Veil helps to disrupt opponents' hands and Treetop Village provides a resilient threat to pressure opponents. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt opponents' game plan to secure a quick victory. The deck's mana base is built around Fetchlands and Twilight Mire to ensure consistent mana sources for its spells.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with artifact creatures and pumping them up with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Springleaf Drum and Mox Opal to accelerate and play multiple threats early on. Ensoul Artifact and Master of Etherium provide additional buffs to your creatures, while Arcbound Ravager can be sacrificed to distribute its counters for a game-winning swing. The deck's synergy and speed make it a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck revolves around controlling the game by utilizing a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and powerful creatures. The deck focuses on establishing early control through cards like Remand and Mana Leak, while also utilizing cards like Lightning Helix and Path to Exile to deal with threats. The deck also includes a mix of powerful creatures like Geist of Saint Traft and Vendilion Clique, along with finishers like Thundermaw Hellkite. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells and ensuring consistency in gameplay.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast and efficient creatures with Infect, a mechanic that allows the deck to win the game by dealing 10 poison counters to the opponent instead of reducing their life total to zero. The key strategy involves playing small but deadly creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, protecting them with spells like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing, and pumping them up with spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa to quickly overwhelm the opponent with poison counters before they can mount a defense.
